settings.title: Lice and Scabies Medicine
settings.subtitle: Lice and Scabies are skin concerns that can be uncomfortable and often itchy. They are treatable and common problems that affect all ages. Find the right medication below.

settings.title: How is lice treated?
settings.text: Lice are small insects that live on the skin and are often connected to the scalp or pubic hair. Symptoms of lice include itchiness around the hair and a feeling like something is crawling on your skin. If you see live lice then you should treat them through the use of special lotions and shampoos. These topical solutions are used alongside physically combing out the lice and eggs.

settings.title: How to treat scabies
settings.text: Scabies is the infestation of a microscopic mite that reproduce on the surface of the skin, later burrowing into it and laying eggs. Treating scabies usually involves using a prescription ointment, cream or lotion to get rid of the infestation. Doctors may also prescribe oral medication if the initial treatment was not successful.

settings.title: Will lice shampoo kill scabies?
settings.text: Lice shampoos, creams and sprays can kill the lice, however, sometimes the lice have become immune to the over-the-counter treatments so a stronger medication is needed. Often, the topical solutions may only kill the lice and not the eggs.

settings.title: Can you have lice and scabies at the same time?
settings.text: You can have lice and scabies at the same time as lice usually affects the hair on the scalp, while scabies is a condition that is caused by mites that dig under the skin.

settings.title: How do you get lice?
settings.text: Lice is a highly contagious condition that is most commonly passed to others due to close proximity. Lice at schools are common due to the nearness of the children and the ability for lice to jump from head to head.

settings.title: Is scabies contagious?
settings.text: Scabies is very contagious and can be passed on to others through skin-to-skin contact or through the touching of contaminated items such as bedding.
